> [gitcenter](#comment_1503_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Not really....
ZeroName is decentralised to save and share domain names to network, but for retrieval part, it doesn't, consider zeroid, here user has to submit username to register, but it's just a random address creation, if you lost a zeroid keys, we cannot recover zeroid, but if we use CNS-gen, will have some data to recover the id from that data. I just say, blockchain is not necessary, but CNS don't stop you to use it, instead of manual logic, you can use blockchain to record domains.

1629038529_12sCaEUFqE6g3JrDqmEA8pn9yrgxw.body:
> [gitcenter](#comment_1514_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): I too [...]
I don't want to make an another or better vanitygen. The goal of the project is to create a better replacement for namecoin domains.

> [styromaniac](#comment_3220_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): How long does your system usually take for five digits?

We can not estimate this, as complete random madness for address generation of btc. some times we may search for a domain, but in mean time generator may find another in less time, this will happen most of the times. Eg: when i search for "zeron" 
results :
```
result : zerox took : 69 secs, pattern: E
result : zerox took : 69 secs, pattern: ZR
result : zeroj took : 91 secs, pattern: ZF
result : zerow took : 400 secs, pattern: RE
result : zerok took : 612 secs, pattern: -4
result : zerok took : 612 secs, pattern: CO
```

Observe those results as, all are 5 letter domains, so we don't get smaller domain(option will be provided in future),
no private/public key will be outputed, as they are not necessary(i will provide an option to show them).

Estimated Avg Time for 5 letter domain will be around 5-10 mins with cpu. This time is based on manual testing by me, while implementing the code.

> [styromaniac](#comment_3224_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): small Independent Blockchain of our own [...]

Exactly, this is my thought, CNS-gen only provides integrity with patterns for an address, blockchain maintainers then use this data to store the data.

Yeah because, we don't have any integrity in vanity addresses, they just give us flexibility.
An Example would be, without going to ZeroHello Page, find which one these below is ZeroHello Address
```
1HeLLo4rGB3ZWaRfR3ApMg488eUZnHfxJN
1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbrbTf3D
1HeLLo45Hr2wrRynAqNjdtNU4NsyQMruWL
1HeLLo4dPRDrGCRrfUED1mEE4msUHVxUVF
1HeLLo4dR2JFPspYm8o6eVM98ZBAbU613D
1HeLLo4bHvwBbf8S3Et589MzAcZRpCmi3d
```
because they all starts with 1Hello, we will not able to differentiate them, this is the problem with tags. If someone takes this as a weapon and use this, the problem will becomes huge.

Say for example, someone hacked my google account(don't worry it's 2FA protected), without my knowledge released an update to ZeroNet Mobile and replaced the default ZeroHello Page in the App, Whole ZeroNet Mobile users will seed that site in instant speed.

> [gitcenter](#comment_1524_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Namecoin--it guarantees that ZeroNetwork.bit ...

CNS will store these addresses generated by CNS-gen as namecoin with/without blockchain, making sure that they are unique. if other providers like to integrate CNS functionality into their system, they can query CNS to get integrity of those addresses.

Remember CNS and CNS-gen are 2 different things, where CNS is a Service provider to Store the domains.

> [gitcenter](#comment_1526_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Please elaborate. [...]

Bitcoin Addresses: Completely Random.
Vanitygen: Gen a Semi Readable Address but don't have integrity in them.
CNS-gen: Gen a Address with a pattern linked to domain
Namecoin: Will add any valid btc to its blockchain. even those by CNS-gen
CNS(or Other Impl): Only Accepts BTC Address, which are valid with domains linked with patterns.

Problems of Namecoin:
We cannot integrate namecoin into every client, because of it's blockchain size, 
namecoin is hard to mine or buy for most of people, this is one of the reason my site doesn't have valid .bit address.
namecoin will only has one extension for domain.


CNS will give flexibility to providers to provide custom extensions.
Suppose on internet, a user wants to register a domain with 
mywebsite.com, but if someone already registered that domain, he has an options like mywebsite.in/.org/.co...
but namecoin will has .bit domain only, no one tried to create other blockchains, i know .eth etc exists but they are not for btc.

CNS implementations will have their own extensions, for example name.yo will have .yo extension for CNS space, where name.yo will become provider for .yo domains.

Consider ZeroName
How many of you, use .bit domains ?
ZeroName has currently 7528 domain now.
Do you know that, there are 1081 domains in them pointing to single address 14VnXCD5dNjcTkc87GMnhizwJ3Rf2Qbrxq ?
Similarly 1NAMEr1kPi3WcT1shaVL6ozYF5bU9oDVG9 has 798 domain names registered.
Similarly 1GirLS7mNQNLjJUVwgWvKTkam8z31fhQ5R has 767 domain names registered.
Similarly 15GAu5QYg34TLzD4b2WMpZSid9S2K6M54h has 247 domain names registered.
Similarly 1MaGiC7b8zqNwL3BvN6ZAzwZVPQ3tjF5hw has 115 domain names registered.
Similarly 1GirLyURo4TcYDx6vP3Tp7KVZoRRhtGWFA has 177 domain names registered.

some useless stuff also exists like "empty" has 16 domain names registered.

Don't you think, this is some kind of spam in every client.

Out of 7528 domain, only 1937 address are unique.
CNS address spaces will avoid these type of issues as well.
